description: The scene depicts two large bulls, dressed in suits, browsing delicate porcelain items in a shop. One bull in the foreground holds a plate while the other stands near shelves laden with teacups and pots. The absurdity lies in the literal portrayal of the idiom "like a bull in a china shop," highlighting the inherent conflict between the creatures' size and the fragile environment. This creates an ironic tension as the bulls navigate a situation where their natural tendencies are ill-suited to the context.
caption: “I got a bad feeling about this, Harriet.”
